description.narrative: The Revised Project Development Objective is to support strengthened institutional performance of targeted urban local governmentsand to contribute to improved infrastructure services in targeted cities.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :- | Description :The appointment of the independent assessment experts expected for annual performanceevaluation of the urban local governments | Due Date :30-Apr-2012
Finance Agreement :Article IV | Description :The Recipient has prepared and adopted, in form and substance satisfactory to theAssociation, the Project Implementation Manual. | Due Date :27-Jan-2012

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section II, B, 4 | Description :Six months following the Effective Date, the PCU shall haverecruited an external auditor with terms of reference and qualifications satisfactory to the Association. | Due Date :27-Jul-2012

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section II, B, 4 | Description :Three months following the Effective Date, the PCU shall haverecruited an internal auditor with terms of reference and qualifications satisfactory to the Association. | Due Date :27-Apr-2012

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2. Section II, B, 4 | Description :Three months following the Effective Date, purchase appropriatecomputer hardware and accounting software to facilitate timely preparation of financial reports. | Due Date :27-Apr-2012

title.narrative: Local government performance assessments conducted on time.
Local governments are informed of the allocations for the subsequent year before the start of the budgeting process
Asset inventory completed and updated yearly for Bamako.
Urban and local government database established and operational with annual reports produced.
A performance-based grant system is established in all project cities and ready to roll out to other ULGs
Municipal budget reports timely generated and acceptable external audits.
Percentage of urban local governments meeting mandatory minimum conditions for access to performance grant funds
Number of people in urban areas provided with access to all-season roads within a 500 meter range under the project
Performance evaluation of Urban Capacity Building Mobile Team carried out.
Percentage of urban local governments achieving at least 75 points on the annual performance evaluation.
Percentage of elected representatives and key LG staff having followed a minimum package of training according to the training planprepared by each ULG.
Percentage of ULGs getting 100 percent of score on percentage variation between actual own source revenue (OSR) collected and the OSR targeted in budget, according to performance evaluation criteria
Asset inventory completed and updated yearly for project secondary cities.
Scores on citizen's perception of their engagement with local government councils and their perceptions of urban management
Number of people with access to improved drainage in the areas served by the project.
Disaggregated list of investments by type and sector.
Performance evaluation carried out by the Direction Générale des Collectivités
Part of population at community level (of which female) satisfied with the budgetary processes at commune level
